alert.note: Alert for Escambia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 25 at 2:39PM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Alabama, including the following county, Baldwin. portions of northwest Florida, including the following county, Escambia. * WHEN...Until 445 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 139 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Foley, Robertsdale, Loxley, Lillian, Magnolia Springs, Bon Secour, Summerdale, Silverhill, Perdido Beach, Elberta, Elsanor, Miflin, Rosinton, Seminole, Marlow, Clay City, River Park, Perdido Heights, Paradise Beach and Montrose. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
